content: I love these ideas! For the Machine Scavenger Hunt, I think I'll create a narrative around a mysterious inventor who has hidden their machines around the room. I'll prepare blueprints and journal entries with cryptic clues to help the kids find and identify the machines. Can you suggest some ways to make the machine blueprints and journal entries more engaging and challenging for the kids? For example, could I include puzzles or ciphers that they need to solve to uncover the clues?
